items.name: Alchemist: Potion Analysis
items.description: An alchemist can analyse the effects of a potion, working from a small sample. Takes 1d6 days. There is a 1-in-6 chance of a false result.

items.name: Alchemist: Potion Brewing
items.description: Alchemists brew potions to order. Costs the potion's standard value and takes 1d6 days per 500gp value. There is a 1-in-6 chance of failure.

items.name: Animal Trainer
items.description: Trainers are required for unusual creatures or for large groups of common animals (e.g. dogs, horses, mules). Each trainer specialises in a single type of animal. Can work with up to 6 animals at a time. Learning the first new behaviour typically takes one month, subsequent behaviours take two weeks each. Training must occur back to back or the animal becomes unable to learn further behaviours.

items.name: Builder
items.description: A skilled builder and engineer who can lead construction projects, designing the structure, sourcing materials, and hiring work crews (included in the building costs). Duration is 1 week per 500gp cost of the building, minimum 1 month. Building costs are halved near settlements due to proximity of labour and resources.

items.name: Builder: Residential Building (Stone)
items.description: Single storey, 30' × 30' building with wooden interior stairs, doors, floors, and attic. Stone walls. Additional storeys (up to three total) may be added for the same cost.

items.name: Builder: Residential Building (Wood)
items.description: Single storey, 30' × 30' building with wooden interior stairs, doors, floors, and attic. Wooden walls. Additional storeys (up to three total) may be added for the same cost.

items.name: Builder: Tower (Small)
items.description: Round tower with 5' thick stone walls. 20' diameter, 30' high, 3 storey tower.

items.name: Builder: Tower (Large)
items.description: Round tower with 5' thick stone walls. 30' diameter, 40' high, 4 storey tower.

items.name: Builder: Castle Wall (10' section)
items.description: Castle wall section, 10' long, 20' high, 10' thick.

items.name: Builder: Keep
items.description: Fortified central building, 60' square, 80' high.

items.name: Builder: Gatehouse
items.description: Fortified gateway through a wall, 30' square, 20' high, with a portcullis.

items.name: Builder: Moat (10' section)
items.description: Moat section, 10' long, 20' wide, 10' deep.

items.name: Builder: Drawbridge
items.description: 20' long drawbridge.

items.name: Builder: Subterranean Construction (10' × 10')
items.description: Underground construction, per 10' × 10' area.

items.name: Guide
items.description: Experts in the tracks and ways of Dolmenwood, each guide specialising in one particular region of the Wood (e.g. Aldweald, Dwelmfurgh, Mulchgrove, etc.). A guide knows the most significant landmarks within their specialist region and can lead PCs to and from these landmarks without risk of getting lost. If the party becomes lost, there is a 4-in-6 chance that the guide finds the path again.

items.name: Guide (Dangerous Regions)
items.description: Guides charge double when entering dangerous regions.

items.name: Mercenary (Standard)
items.description: Foot soldiers, some of whom may be specialists with bows or crossbows. Equipped with chainmail, longsword (1d8). 1-in-3 also has a longbow (1d6) or crossbow (1d8). Level 1, AC 14, HP 1d8 (4), Morale 7. During wartime, demand double pay. Refuse to delve into dungeons without military objective.

items.name: Mercenary (Cavalry)
items.description: Heavily armoured soldiers mounted on chargers. Equipped with plate mail, lance (1d6), longsword (1d8), charger. Level 1, AC 16, HP 1d8 (4), Speed 20 (40 mounted), Morale 8. During wartime, demand double pay.

items.name: Mercenary (Lieutenant)
items.description: Veterans who command a small team of soldiers within a company. One lieutenant required for every 10 mercenaries. Equipped with chainmail, longsword (1d8). Level 2, AC 14, HP 2d8 (9), Morale 8. During wartime, demand double pay.

items.name: Mercenary (Captain)
items.description: Experienced soldiers and tacticians who lead a mercenary company. A company cannot be hired without its captain. Equipped with plate mail, shield, longsword (1d8). Level 3, AC 17, HP 3d8 (13), Morale 9. During wartime, demand double pay.

items.name: Pack Handler
items.description: Semi-skilled wagon drivers, animal handlers, and porters. Useful for handling mounts, loading and unloading equipment, driving land vehicles, setting or watching camp. Pack handlers absolutely refuse to enter dangerous regions.

items.name: Rower
items.description: Unskilled labourers hired to row water vessels.

items.name: Sage: Translation
items.description: A sage can translate any language associated with their specialist field. Cost per inscription or per page of text. Sage specialisations include: astronomy, devils, fairies, gems, herbs, history, wyrms.

items.name: Sage: Basic Lore / Item Identification
items.description: A sage can identify items and answer basic questions relating to their specialist field. Sage specialisations include: astronomy, devils, fairies, gems, herbs, history, wyrms.

items.name: Sage: Detailed Lore Research
items.description: More obscure questions require a period of dedicated research lasting one or more months (as judged by the Referee). There is a 5% chance that the research results in a false or misleading answer. Sage specialisations include: astronomy, devils, fairies, gems, herbs, history, wyrms.

items.name: Sailor
items.description: Trained in the handling of sailing ships and other large water vessels. Sailors are usually equipped with a shortsword, shield, and leather armour.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 1 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more. Lesser runes count as Rank 1.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 2 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 3 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 4 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more. Greater runes count as Rank 4.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 5 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more.

items.name: Spell-Caster: Rank 6 Spell
items.description: Rare individuals willing to cast arcane spells, fairy runes, or holy spells in return for payment. May require completion of a quest in addition to monetary payment. Spells for illegal or morally dubious ends may cost double or more. Mighty runes count as Rank 6.
